lines.text: I had to get you away from those people.
People? They're only shadows. There's nothing real but you.
The Bishop's going to make a few demands, you know.
You'll have to promise to love, honor and obey.
Well, alright, you can leave out the obey, if you want.
I don't want to leave out anything. I want it all.
Wait. I'm, I'm going to be afraid without you. Do you, do you still want to marry me?
I'm pretending nothing. You know I don't love you. I, I never could love anyone, again.
Well, we'll have a unique kind of marriage. One that's never been done before. We'll leave the word love out entirely and substitute the word honesty.
Can you, forgive me for what we've lost?
Perhaps we've lost nothing. Perhaps everything that happened has been for this one moment. I've never felt so new. Everything's going to begin from now.
I'll never be lost again. Nothing to be afraid of. No more ghosts.
